chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
worlds: Type

Goal:
SeparationAlgebra worlds

Premises:
SeparationAlgebra : forall worlds : Type, Join worlds -> Prop
trivial_SA = fun worlds : Type => {| join_comm := fun (m1 m2 m : worlds) (H : join m1 m2 m) => H; join_assoc := fun (mx my mz mxy mxyz : worlds) (H : join mx my mxy) (_ : join mxy mz mxyz) => let H1 : exists myz : worlds, join my mz myz /\ join mx myz mxyz := match H return (exists myz : worlds, join my mz myz /\ join mx myz mxyz) with end in H1 |} : forall worlds : Type, SeparationAlgebra worlds Argument worlds is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Join = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> Join worlds -> Prop
Relation = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> Ensemble worlds : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
join = fun (worlds : Type) (Join : Join worlds) => Join : forall worlds : Type, Join worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop Arguments worlds, Join are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
Krelation = fun (worlds : Type) (Relation : Relation worlds) => Relation : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> worlds -> Ensemble worlds Arguments worlds, Relation are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Build_SeparationAlgebra : forall (worlds : Type) (SA : Join worlds), (forall m1 m2 m : worlds, join m1 m2 m -> join m2 m1 m) -> (forall mx my mz mxy mxyz : worlds, join mx my mxy -> join mxy mz mxyz -> exists myz : worlds, join my mz myz /\ join mx myz mxyz) -> SeparationAlgebra worlds
trivial_Join = fun (worlds : Type) (_ _ _ : worlds) => False : forall worlds : Type, Join worlds Argument worlds is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
residue = fun (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds) (m n : worlds) => exists n' : worlds, join n n' m /\ Krelation m n' : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> Join worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop Arguments worlds, R, J are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
join_comm : forall m1 m2 m : ?worlds, join m1 m2 m -> join m2 m1 m where ?worlds : [worlds : Type |- Type] ?SA : [worlds : Type |- Join ?worlds] ?SeparationAlgebra : [worlds : Type |- SeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
join_assoc : forall mx my mz mxy mxyz : ?worlds, join mx my mxy -> join mxy mz mxyz -> exists myz : ?worlds, join my mz myz /\ join mx myz mxyz where ?worlds : [worlds : Type |- Type] ?SA : [worlds : Type |- Join ?worlds] ?SeparationAlgebra : [worlds : Type |- SeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
unit_SA = {| join_comm := fun (m1 m2 m : unit) (_ : join m1 m2 m) => I; join_assoc := fun (mx my mz mxy mxyz : unit) (_ : join mx my mxy) (_ : join mxy mz mxyz) => ex_intro (fun myz : unit => join my mz myz /\ join mx myz mxyz) tt (conj I I) |} : SeparationAlgebra unit
residual_extensible : forall u : ?worlds, exists e v : ?worlds, join u e v where ?worlds : [worlds : Type |- Type] ?R : [worlds : Type |- Relation ?worlds] ?po_R : [worlds : Type |- PreOrder Krelation] ?J : [worlds : Type |- Join ?worlds] ?SA : [worlds : Type |- SeparationAlgebra ?worlds] ?dSA : [worlds : Type |- DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra ?worlds] ?resSA : [worlds : Type |- ResidualSeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
BinInt.Z.divide_trans : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide n m -> BinInt.Z.divide m p -> BinInt.Z.divide n p
InitialRing.gen_phiZ1_pos_sub : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : BinNums.positive, req (InitialRing.gen_phiZ1 rO rI radd rmul ropp (BinInt.Z.pos_sub x y)) (radd (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul x) (ropp (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul y)))
BinInt.Z.max_l : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le m n -> BinInt.Z.max n m = n
BinNat.N.bits_inj : forall a b : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.eqf (BinNat.N.testbit a) (BinNat.N.testbit b) -> a = b
BinInt.Z.one_succ = eq_refl : BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH = BinInt.Z.succ BinNums.Z0
SetoidList.InA_cons_hd : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (x y : A) (l : list A), eqA x y -> SetoidList.InA eqA x (y :: l)
ssrfun.all_equal_to : forall T : Type, T -> Prop
BinInt.Z.divide_transitive = BinInt.Z.divide_trans : Transitive BinInt.Z.divide
BinPosDef.Pos.pred_double = fix pred_double (x : BinNums.positive) : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinNums.xI (BinNums.xO p) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xI (pred_double p) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xH end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Argument scope is [positive_scope]
BinNatDef.N.testbit = fun a n : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => false | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.testbit p n end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add x (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
BinInt.Z.Rlt_wd : forall z : BinNums.Z, Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) (fun n m : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.le z n /\ BinInt.Z.lt n m)
EnvRing.Psub : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C
InitialRing.ropp_ext3_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req) ropp
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
EnvRing.Popp : forall C : Type, (C -> C) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C
EnvRing.Ppow_N : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.N -> EnvRing.Pol C
BinNat.N.pow_neg_r : forall n p : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt p BinNums.N0 -> BinNat.N.pow n p = BinNums.N0
Znumtheory.prime_rel_prime : forall p : BinNums.Z, Znumtheory.prime p -> forall a : BinNums.Z, ~ BinInt.Z.divide p a -> Znumtheory.rel_prime p a
QArith_base.Qnum = fun q : QArith_base.Q => let (Qnum, _) := q in Qnum : QArith_base.Q -> BinNums.Z
Inductive N : Set := N0 : BinNums.N | Npos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.N For Npos: Argument scope is [positive_scope]
Setoid.Setoid_Theory : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop
BinInt.Z.max_spec : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m /\ BinInt.Z.max n m = m \/ BinInt.Z.le m n /\ BinInt.Z.max n m = n
BinIntDef.Z.succ_double = fun x : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Zpos p => BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xI p) | BinNums.Zneg p => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.pred_double p) end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
Field_theory.field_is_integral_domain : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall r1 r2 : R, ~ req r1 rO -> ~ req r2 rO -> ~ req (rmul r1 r2) rO
list_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Type), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Qreduction.Qred_lt : forall q q' : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt (Qreduction.Qred q) (Qreduction.Qred q') < -> QArith_base.Qlt q q'

```coq
apply Build_SeparationAlgebra with (Join := trivial_Join worlds).
- intros m1 m2 m H. apply H.
- intros mx my mz mxy mxyz H1 H2. exists mz. split.
  + apply join_comm with (m1 := my) (m2 := mz). apply H2.
  + apply join_assoc with (mx := mx) (my := my) (mz := mz) (mxy := mxy) (mxyz := mxyz) in H1. apply H1.
Qed.
```

original: apply Build_SeparationAlgebra with (Join := trivial_Join worlds). - intros m1 m2 m H. apply H. - intros mx my mz mxy mxyz H1 H2. exists mz. split. + apply join_comm with (m1 := my) (m2 := mz). apply H2. + apply join_assoc with (mx := mx) (my := my) (mz := mz) (mxy := mxy) (mxyz := mxyz) in H1. apply H1.
